result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harold J Boyd

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

2:22 PM; Case called for Initial appearance. Defendant Harold J Boyd in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jayne Davis Dewire in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Cassandra Miller appeared as a friend of the Court.  Court provides the defendant with a copy of the Complaint and reviews the charges on the record. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Court will adjourn for pretrial conference to tag along with the defendant's other case.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:53 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Harold J Boyd not in court. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant.
The Court will issue but STAY a $500.00 arrest warrant.
EXT CODE 3.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
